docs.lead_paragraph: They were typical baby pictures: a snapshot of a smiling mother cradling her infant son; the proud father, cooing and making a silly face. Typical except for the baby's skin. It hung like a loose sweatshirt from his tiny arms and legs.

headline.main: Trial Focuses on Whether Mother Meant to Kill Her Baby

docs.abstract: Trial of Tabitha Walrond, accused of starving her baby to death while breast feeding him, continues in New York State Supreme Court, Bronx; testimony focuses on whether Walrond meant to kill her baby (M)
docs.snippet: They were typical baby pictures: a snapshot of a smiling mother cradling her infant son; the proud father, cooing and making a silly face.    Typical except for the baby's skin. It hung like a loose sweatshirt from his tiny arms and legs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The teen-age birth rate, which has been dropping steadily for six years, has dipped so sharply that it has helped push the nation's overall birth rate to the lowest point since the Government began keeping records in 1909, according to data made public today by the National Center for Health Statistics. The birth rate, calculated as the number of births per 1,000 people in a given group, is one measure of how the native-born population grows. The rate among girls ages 15 to 19 dropped 16 percent from 1991 to 1997, the most recent year for which figures are available. In one year alone, from 1996 to 1997, the rate dropped 4 percent.

headline.main: Birth Rate at New Low as Teen-Age Pregnancy Declines

docs.abstract: Data from National Center for Health Statistics shows teen-age birth rate has dipped so sharply that it has helped push nation's overall birth rate to lowest point since Government began keeping records in 1909; rate among girls ages 15 to 19 dropped 16 percent from 1991 to 1997; rate dropped 4 percent in one year alone, from 1996 to 1997; center says that in absolute numbers, there were fewer babies born in 1997--3.88 million, nearly 500,000 of them to teen-agers--than in any year since 1987 (M)
